repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
ml_line_len -> ml_line_textlen

Relying that `ml_line_len` never accounted for text properties, unlike Vim.

comment_data.body: `curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_textlen` and `len + 1` are always the same value here in Nvim.
Diverging from Vim by replacing `memmove` with `memcpy` (ie. xmemdupz) since Nvim doesn't have deal with text properties past `NUL`.

```suggestion
  colnr_T ml_line_textlen;      // length of the cached line + NUL
```
This seems wrong. `ml_get_buf_len()` subtracts 1 from the length.
This was in search of failing assertion and test failures (before I realized `ml_line_textlen = 0` is the problem).
It's a bit inconsistent. It seems that `len - 2` considers `NUL`, but `lp.col >= len` doesn't...
I'll just assume this has to account for text properties going past NUL.
I don't think it accounts for text properties properly. `len - 2` may be in the middle of a text property.

comment_regular_data.body:
> ml_line_len -> ml_line_textlen

I think it's better to do it the other way around, as `ml_line_len` appears in more places in Vim than `ml_line_textlen`.

Also, another problem here is that, in Vim, `ml_line_len` is correct after a call to `ml_get_buf()`, while `ml_line_textlen` is only correct after a call to `ml_get_buf_len()`, so you cannot use a `= 0` assignment when these two variables are combined. I think any `ml_line_textlen = 0` assignment is N/A if `ml_line_len` is already correct.

I went with `ml_line_textlen` to be explicit that Nvim isn't supporting Vim's text property implementation and to resolve memory issues now in this MR.

Removed support for `ml_line_textlen == 0`  because spamming `colnr_T len = get_cursor_line_len();` and similar code is beyond scope of the patch.

`ml_line_len` is correct when I ported `ml_line_textlen = 0;`. Opted to make the new `ml_line_textlen` value more explicit to sync with memory allocation.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability.
repo.name: neovim

title: vim-patch:9.1.{151,153,163}
